intro: Astraea cincta, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Astraea cincta thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
